content: lido brioche headband easy to knit brioche headband is the perfect middle season accessory the headband is worked in one piece back and forth on straight or circular needles this pattern is easy to follow and suitable for beginners knitting their first ever brioche piece instruction video that will help you with the cast on and finish of your headband is available on my youtube channel yarn suggestions medium weight yarn aran/worsted approximately 100 m - drops - daisy 50g = 110 m and kid silk 25g = 210 m one strand of each yarn is held together - föa - natua 50g = 100 m and föa - nuvia 25g = 225 m one strand of each yarn is held together - föa - tinta 100g = 200 m and föa - nuvia 25g = 225 m one strand of each yarn is held together - knitting for olive - heavy merino 50g = 125m - filcolana - peruvian 50g = 100m cid 86 cid 89 cid 3 cid 72 cid 85 cid 96 cid 3 cid 96 cid 72 cid 89 cid 85 cid 3 cid 91 cid 86 cid 3 cid 86 cid 73 cid 91 cid 72 cid 80 cid 85 cid 3 cid 91 cid 79 cid 76 cid 3 cid 78 cid 72 cid 92 cid 78 cid 76 cid 21 cid 176 cid 3 cid 3 gauge cid 33 cid 176 16 x 20 stitches in briche stitch = 10 cm 4 in using the needles no 4 5 mm us/uk 7 after washing and blocking needles cid 33 cid 176 circular or straight needles no 4 5 mm us/uk 7 1 marker and tapestry needle sizes cid 33 cid 176 s m l 51 53 55 cm head circumference 55 57 59 cm headband is knitted with 4 cm negative ease width is 10 5 cm abbreviations rs - right side row every odd row ws - wrong side row every even row k - knit p - purl st / sts - stitch / stitches yo - yarn over sl1wyif - slip one stitch purl-wise with the yarn in front sl1yo - bring the yarn in front and over the right needle then slip one stitch purl-wise brk1 - knit 1 stitch together with its yarn over instructions loosely cast-on 17 sts with the needles no 4 5 mm us/uk 7 or any other needles to obtain the gauge https //youtu be/ynnrkz4j2ao 1st row rs - k1 *k1 sl1yo* repeat from * to * to the last 2 stitches k2 2nd row ws - sl1wyif *sl1yo brk1* repeat from * to * to the last 2 stitches sl1yo sl1wyif 3rd row rs place marker to mark the rs of your work - k1 *brk1 sl1yo* repeat to the last 2 stitches brk1 k1 repeat row 2 and 3 until you knit desired length and loosely cast-off i recommend you measure your head circumference and knit your headband 4 cm shorter here
